Topics: Chapter heading on Sa'y (Running between al-Safa and al-Marwa)

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) regarding the saying of Allah the Exalted: "Indeed, al-Safa and al-Marwa are from the symbols of Allah. So whoever performs Hajj of the House or Umrah, there is no blame upon him to perform Sa'y between them." (Quran 2:158). He said: "There were idols upon them, and the Muslims felt reluctance to perform Sa'y between them because of the idols. So Allah the Exalted revealed: 'So that there would not be upon them hardship in circumambulating them because of the idols.'"

He prays them with one adhan and one iqamah, then they spend the night there. When he prays Fajr and stands with the people at al-Mash'ar al-Haram until the sun is about to rise, then they depart with tranquility and dignity." Topics: Chapter heading on Stoning the Pillars (Jamarat) during Hajj

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): "The days of stoning are: The Day of Sacrifice, which is the tenth day. He stones Jamrat al-Aqabah on that day with seven pebbles after the sun rises, glorifying Allah with each pebble, and he does not stone any other Jamra on that day. And three days after the Day of Sacrifice: the eleventh day, the twelfth day, and the thirteenth day. On these days he stones the three Jamarat after noon, each Jamra with seven pebbles, glorifying Allah with each pebble. He stands at the first two Jamarat but does not stand at Jamrat al-Aqabah."

Topics: Chapter heading on Tawaf al-Ziyarah (Visitation Circumambulation)

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) regarding the saying of Allah the Exalted: "Then let them complete their ritual obligations, and let them fulfill their vows, and let them circumambulate the Ancient House." (Quran 22:29). He said: "This is Tawaf al-Ziyarah on the Day of Sacrifice, and it is the obligatory Tawaf. So when a man performs Tawaf al-Ziyarah, for him are permitted perfume and women. And if he shortens his hair and slaughters but does not circumambulate, then for him are permitted perfume and hunting and garments, but women are not permitted for him until he circumambulates the House." And Zayd ibn Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) said: "The obligations of Hajj are three: Ihram, standing at Arafat, and Tawaf al-Ziyarah on the Day of Sacrifice."

Topics: Chapter heading on Clothing for the Muhrim (pilgrim in state of Ihram)

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): "The muhrim does not wear a shirt, nor trousers, nor socks, nor a turban, nor a hat, nor a garment dyed with woad or saffron. He said: And if the muhrim does not find shoes, he wears socks cut below the ankles. And if he does not find an izar (wrapper), he wears trousers. So if he does not find a rida' (upper garment) and finds a shirt, he wraps himself in it but does not wear it as a tunic."

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): "When in the time of Umar's governorship, a group of people from the inhabitants of Syria came while in the state of Ihram and found ostrich eggs. They trampled, broke, and took them. They came to Umar in his governorship and he was stern with them and rebuked them. Then he said: 'Follow me' until he came to Ali. They came to Ali and he was in his land with a spade in his hand digging the earth. Umar struck him on his arm and said: 'He (the one who named you) Abu Turab did not make a mistake.' The people told the story to Ali ibn Abi Talib, and Ali said: 'Go to female camels in their prime, have them bred by a strong male, and whatever they bear, slaughter it for Allah the Exalted.' Umar said: 'O Abu al-Hasan, some of the eggs become infertile.' Ali replied: 'And some of the camels are infertile too?' And I asked Zayd ibn Ali about the compensation for hunting, and he said: 'It requires compensation.' He said: 'And if you do not find what to slaughter, estimate its value in food, then give it as charity to the poor.' He said: 'And if he does not find what to feed, he fasts in place of every half sa' one day.' And I asked Zayd ibn Ali about the one performing both Hajj and Umrah together (Qarin), and he said: 'Two expiations are upon him.' I asked Zayd ibn Ali: 'If a non-muhrim kills game in the Sacred Precinct, what is upon him?' He said: 'Compensation is upon him.' I said: 'And if a muhrim kills game in the Sacred Precinct?' He said: 'Two expiations are upon him.'"

If they do not find one, they fast three days during the Hajj, the last of which is the Day of Arafat, and seven days when they return to their families. This is for those whose families are not residents of the Sacred Mosque."
